meanings.definition: Make (a doubt, feeling, or belief) disappear.
meanings.sent1: She tried to dispel her fear by talking to a friend.
meanings.sent2: The sun's warmth dispelled the morning chill.
meanings.sent3: To dispel the idea that cats are afraid of water, she showed a video of a cat swimming.
meanings.sent4: His smile had the power to dispel any sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician waved his wand to dispel the illusion and reveal the truth.

meanings.definition: Drive away or cause to vanish.
meanings.sent1: The scarecrow helped dispel the birds from the cornfield.
meanings.sent2: The bright light was able to dispel the darkness in the room.
meanings.sent3: The superhero used his powers to dispel the villains from the city.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter could dispel any tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The wind began to dispel the clouds, revealing a clear blue sky.
